title: Russia Warns of Reprisals for Crimea Bridge Attack
description: Bitter over a strike against a vital bridge, Moscow hit civilian areas of Ukraine with a barrage of rockets, and some Ukrainians feared worse to come.

title: Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant Gets Power Restored After Shelling
description: The leader of the International Atomic Energy Agency said getting the plant reconnected to outside power was a “temporary relief in a still untenable situation.”

title: Russians fleeing the draft find an unlikely haven in Central Asia.
As Ukraine Forces Press Offensive, Front Line Is Shifting Fast
description: Evidence of killings and torture is discovered in a forest camp outside the village of Borova as Ukrainian soldiers recapture territory.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Russia Strikes Key City
description: Plus funerals for rampage victims in Thailand and a Covid spike in China

title: ‘Eye of Sauron’: The Dazzling Solar Tower in the Israeli Desert
description: Looming over a remote village in the Negev, the Ashalim solar plant is, for some, a marvel of green technology. For others, it’s a boondoggle and an eyesore.

title: Putin Blames Ukraine For Crimea Bridge Blast, Calling It ‘Terrorism’
description: Mr. Putin’s remarks were his first about Saturday’s explosion on the Kerch Strait Bridge.

title: Biden turns to lessons from the Cuban Missile Crisis to deal with Putin’s nuclear threat.
Former Gov. Bill Richardson ‘Cautiously Optimistic’ About Griner’s Release
description: Bill Richardson, the former ambassador to the U.N., has been at odds with the White House over his private talks with Russia.

title: Deadly Strikes Hit Key Southern City as Russia Restores Some Traffic on Damaged Bridge
description: Less than a day after an explosion damaged Moscow’s bridge to Crimea, Russian missiles again hit residential areas of Zaporizhzhia, local officials said.

title: Russia Rushes to Restore Traffic After Crimea Bridge Explosion
description: An explosion a day earlier partly damaged the span and embarrassed the Kremlin.

title: The West Has a Migration Crisis. Why Does Rwanda Want to Help?
description: The small African nation has positioned itself as an altruistic partner of wealthier countries seeking to curb migration. But experts say Rwanda’s human rights record makes it no refuge for asylum seekers.

title: Greece Tries Stationing Police on Campus, and Students Fight Back
description: For decades, law enforcement was rarely allowed on university grounds. Critics say that putting officers there is part of a slide toward authoritarianism.

title: Ukraine wants a long-range American missile. The U.S. is holding it back.
North Korea’s Threat
description: Frustrated and isolated, the North is conducting more missile tests than ever.

title: Deadly Shooting at Israeli Checkpoint Sets Jerusalem on Edge
description: Surging violence claimed the lives of four Palestinians and an Israeli soldier over the weekend, raising tensions on the eve of a Jewish holiday.

title: Why Strict but Inconsistent Gun Laws Did Not Keep Thailand Safe
description: Firearm policy is strict for some people and lax for others, a recipe for problems. The horrific attack by an ex-policeman may spur calls for change, but it will not be easy.

title: An American in Ukraine Finds the War He’s Been Searching For
description: For an unconventional former Marine colonel, Ukraine represents the morally just war that eluded him his entire career. But how much can he and his military start-up help?

title: An American in Ukraine Finds the War He’s Been Searching For
description: For an unconventional former Marine colonel, Ukraine represents the morally just war that eluded him his entire career. But how much can he and his military start-up help?

title: Blast on Crimean Bridge Deals Blow to Russian War Effort in Ukraine
description: Any impediment to traffic on the bridge could affect Russia’s ability to wage war in southern Ukraine, where Ukraine’s forces have been fighting an increasingly effective counteroffensive.
